mapper.sql: SELECT id , code , `alias_code` AS aliasCode, `name` , `type` , collect_interval AS collectInterval, `category` , source , provider , description , user_permission AS userPermission, create_time AS createTime, create_by AS `createBy.id`, update_time AS updateTime, update_by AS `updateBy.id`, status FROM metric m
mapper.insert: INSERT INTO metric( id , code , `alias_code` , `name` , `type` , `collect_interval`, `category` , source , provider , description, user_permission, create_time, create_by , update_time, update_by , status) VALUES( #{id}, #{code}, #{aliasCode}, #{name}, #{type}, #{collectInterval}, #{category}, #{source}, #{provider}, #{description}, #{userPermission}, #{createTime}, #{createBy.id}, #{updateTime}, #{updateBy.id}, #{status})
mapper.update: UPDATE metric SET `alias_code` = #{aliasCode}, `name` = #{name}, `type` = #{type}, `collect_interval` = #{collectInterval}, `category` = #{category}, source = #{source}, provider = #{provider}, description = #{description}, user_permission = #{userPermission}, status = #{status}, update_time = #{updateTime}, update_by = #{updateBy.id} WHERE id=#{id}
UPDATE metric SET update_by = #{updateBy.id}, update_time = #{updateTime}, `status` = #{status} WHERE id = #{id}
